intro: Leucohyle mutica, commonly known as the silky leucohyle, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its habitat preferences, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
